title: Why don't airline headrests tip back a bit for sleeping on longer flights - the one thing that would make them tolerable? - Quora

response.answer_text: Peter - that's a sensible response.  However....... 1. A lock/release system would probably be sufficient and... 2. How often do jetliners get rear-ended?    Or were you thinking where the angle of climb in an aborted landing is too high and the plane falls to earth tail first? Just saying...
Because that would mean a handful of less seats. The airline is looking to squeeze every penny out of every flight and cram as many people as regulations allow.
